text: The Steelfist of the Baersonling is as gigantic as he is mighty, a warrior of rarely seen quality.
As the Northern Warlord, Einarr's authority on the battlefield is unmatched. His presence inspires troops to fight with heightened morale and effectiveness during campaigns and battles.
Einarr's Norse Diplomatic Acumen improves diplomatic relations with other Norscan tribes, making alliances and trade agreements more attainable.
Known for his resilience in the harsh North, Einarr's Northern Resilience reduces attrition and enhances the survival capabilities of his armies in cold climates.

Einarr enters the Berserker's Frenzy, an unstoppable melee rampage where his attacks become more ferocious and deadly. In this state, he disregards defense, focusing solely on dealing devastating blows to his adversaries.
Einarr taps into his Berserker Rage during battle, increasing his own combat prowess and that of nearby allies, turning the tide in close-quarters engagements.
Einarr employs Viking Raider Tactics, allowing his armies to conduct swift and devastating raids on coastal settlements, disrupting enemy economies and bolstering his own treasury.
Einarr's Baersonling heritage unlocks unique recruitment options for Norscan units, instilling a sense of cultural pride and loyalty within his army.
Einarr's Glacial Battlefield Tactician skill provides strategic advantages in frozen landscapes, granting his armies enhanced movement and effectiveness in icy terrains.
Marauder Chieftains may devote themselves to Tzeentch, becoming powerful Chaos Lords of Tzeentch
Dedicated to Tzeentch: May only devote himself to Tzeentch
You should have known antagonists never end up well..

Wielding the honor-laden title of Jarl of Vinnskor and standing proudly among the Baersonlings, Tulkir bears the weight of three decades of relentless battle on his broad shoulders. At his side, a once-magnificent blade known as Fangwyrm, now halved in valor, narrates tales of the Jarl's unyielding resilience. This magnificent weapon, snapped to less than half its former glory in the clash against the bloodbeast of the Aeslings, found renewed purpose as Einarr Sigdansson, a mighty Champion among the Baersonlings, reforged it. Despite its fracture, Fangwyrm remains a symbol of Tulkir's enduring strength and the sacrifices made in the relentless pursuit of honor and victory.
A fierce Baersonling of the fallen village of Vinnskor and a mighty Champion of Tzeentch, Einarr Steelfist was marked by the Raven God when he slew a mighty Bloodbeast.
Blessed by Tzeentch, Fangwyrm is a mighty blade once wielded by Jarl Tulkir. It feeds on nearby magic and radiates immense power.
The amulet has the spirit of a Snow Troll bound within it. Those who wear it are said to begin taking on the traits of the Troll themselves.
The magical weapon was crafted out of the skull of a White Dragon, who was known for preferring killing his victims with one mighty bite of his enormous jaws.
Gifted by the Lord of Change, Bregða's stare seems to freeze even the fiercest of foes. As if he gains deep insight into the fate of those who oppose him.
Gifted by the Lord of Change, Bregða's stare seems to freeze even the fiercest of foes. As if he gains deep insight into the fate of those who oppose him.
Gifted by the Lord of Change, Bregða's stare seems to freeze even the fiercest of foes. As if he gains deep insight into the fate of those who oppose him.
Einarr wears the magic infused gauntlets of Valbrandr who slayed Ogres with nothing but his iron clad protected hands.
Amidst all the lifeless bodies of the village of Vinnskor, Einarr - sole survivor - held the corpse of his son as he detonated in nothing but mindless rage.

Parchment has been seen falling from the skies over nearby battlefields. The scribblings upon them bind powerful magics into the pages, waiting to be unlocked by any who might claim them. Where they came from or why they litter the fields of war remains a mystery, yet one thing is for certain: every word brims with the Changer's arcane power. If the culprits behind this flurry of spells are ever to be located, questions must be asked. Perhaps those captured in battle may have tales to tell us?

Your investigation has proven fruitful, indeed. It seems the Blue Scribes of Tzeentch ??P'tarix and Xirat'p ??are the frenzied force behind the haphazard magics that have plagued so many battlefields across the land. Better yet, a clue to their current location has now reared its head, as Chaos surges within a nearby settlement. If you act quickly, you could capture the region before the Blue Scribes have chance to move on, spreading their twisted mischief further outside of your reach.

Your investigation has proven fruitful, indeed. It seems the Blue Scribes of Tzeentch ??P'tarix and Xirat'p ??are the frenzied force behind the haphazard magics that have plagued so many battlefields across the land. Better yet, a clue to their current location has now reared its head, as Chaos surges within a nearby settlement. If you act quickly, you could capture the region before the Blue Scribes have chance to move on, spreading their twisted mischief further outside of your reach.
A Tale of the True Path

Word has spread of a noble’s son, a once-great Knight of the Empire, who roams the Chaos Wastes in search of a greater purpose. Most remarkably he bears the insignia of a Tzeentchian cult, the Brethren of the Golden Eagle. His loyalties had him pursued doggedly for a time by the Templars of Sigmar, the Empire’s Witch Hunters, but once they caught up he proved his status as the greatest swordsman in his Knightly Order. Perhaps in time this Champion-in-the-making will make his way to us, but in the meantime we must ensure there are more like-minded warriors to help him embrace Chaos.
A Tale of the True Path

The noble breath of the wandering Knight is carried as a whisper upon the Winds, speaking of a tall monolith he has encountered deep in the Chaos Wastes that holds history, magic and prophecy. Yet standing between the Knight and the answers leading him to Chaos’ embrace is a bloodthirsty Doombull and his warherd! If this warrior is ever to reach his full potential in Tzeentch’s estimations we must provide him with the assistance he might require to reach the revelations he seeks.
His terrible Mark shows he has sworn to a new master
Asta of Vinnskor is reunited with the Baersonling Tribe

Amidst the windswept ruins of Vinnskor, Einarr Sigdansson, the Champion of Tzeentch, uncovers a shard of hope amidst the wreckage of his shattered past. Whispers carry tales of his beloved Asta, once thought lost to the cruel blades of the Aeslings, now rumored to roam the dense forests of Bretonnia. Asta, chieftess of Vinnskor and skilled huntress, was torn from her home and sold into the clutches of a Bretonnian noble, destined to serve as a slave in a foreign court. //n//n Driven by a firestorm of vengeance and longing, Einarr embarks on a perilous journey beyond the storm-tossed seas, his resolve unyielding as he sails towards the sun-kissed shores of Bretonnia. With the promise of Asta's liberation burning brightly in his heart, Einarr sets forth to raid the lands of Bordeleaux, where rumors whisper of her elusive presence. In the heart of enemy territory, amidst the opulent halls of nobility and the twisted alleys of Bretonnian towns, lies the key to unlocking Asta's chains.

In the frigid expanse of the northern lands lies Vinnskor, once a thriving village of the Baersonling tribe, now desolate and overrun by our enemies. As Einarr Sigdansson, son of Sigdan, it falls upon you to reclaim what was lost and restore honor to your people. The ruins of Vinnskor hold the echoes of our ancestors, and it is time to silence the whispers of defeat that linger there. March forth with courage, for the fate of our tribe rests on your shoulders. Let the blood of our enemies stain the snow as we reclaim Vinnskor and rebuild our legacy
A mission is triggered to unlock a Legendary Hero

A raven speaks in your dream, perched upon a shadowed cairn. Its words are soft but carry power: "All can be as it once was." You awaken with those words carved into your thoughts, their truth echoing louder than your doubts.

Einarr kneels where Asta died, the ruins silent around him. The raven returns—and this time, it reveals its true form. It is no mere bird, but the Raven God himself: Tzeentch. He offers a pact: reclaim an artifact stolen by Nurgle, and time itself shall be turned back. Asta, Vinnskor, all may be restored. But no path is free of cost. To reach the Palace of Nurgle, Einarr must gather strength. He must choose his allies—will it be the witch or the wolf?

Tzeentch commands it: cross the Frozen Sea, leave behind what was once familiar. In the Chaos Wastes, Einarr must forge new alliances, break old oaths, and face horrors not born of man. And as the miles pass, so too does the clarity of thought—he begins to forget his own name.

Two armies clash in the mist: one a host of shimmering sorcery, the other of iron and rage. Scouts whisper that both armies seek to slay Bubos, the dragon that guards the gate to the Palace of Nurgle. Surely, should Einarr aid one, they would reveal its location. Tzeentch urges a decision. There is no neutrality in the Wastes. Will you side with the cultist or the warrior?

The air thickens with decay. Bubos lies dead, and the gates of the Plague God's domain rise ahead. But something stirs within you, a presence clawing up through your spine. You no longer know if the thoughts in your mind are your own. The Wastes do not forget, nor do they forgive. You march as a man twisted by prophecy.

Madness has taken you, and yet your hand is steady. The Palace of Nurgle must fall. The warband marches behind a broken man with fire in his eyes. Skoroth, Lord of the Palace, awaits within. The final door creaks open on hinges of rot and bone. Einarr’s destiny is no longer his own.
Palace of the Plaguelord: The Aesling Raid
Relive the Aesling onslaught in your dreams. The rage it brings may yet be shaped into purpose.In flame and blood, the seeds of vengeance are sown.
Palace of the Plaguelord: Whispers of Faith
Reach rank 5 to begin forging the strength needed to shape your fate and challenge the will of the gods. A leader’s worth is not born but carved in the fires of battle.
Palace of the Plaguelord: Ashes of Vinnskor
Take back the remains of Vinnskor and restore a foothold for your scattered people. Begin rebuilding the future from ash and memory. From shattered stones, the Baerson legacy will rise anew
Palace of the Plaguelord: The Witch or The Wolf
The wild path calls. Recruit two Werekin heroes to lead your fury across the blighted North. Let tooth and claw be your guide through the dark woods ahead.
Winds of sorcery stir. Recruit two Shaman Sorcerers to guide you through Tzeentch’s twisting schemes. The skein of fate is tangled—only the witches may know how to pull the right thread.
Palace of the Plaguelord: The Icy Crossing
Raid the Monolith of Bubonicus, defiling Nurgle’s claim and staking your place in the Wastes.Let your warband's banner be planted in blight, not bowed before it.
Palace of the Plaguelord: The Rotborn Gatekeeper
Defeat Bubos the Plague-Dragon who guards the Lake of Rot. The path to the Plaguelord’s Palace lies beyond. One winged beast blocks your path—tear it from the sky.
Palace of the Plaguelord: The Final Push
Destroy the Tallymen of Pestilence, the Maggot Host, and the Maggoth Kin. Break their hold on the Wastes.Leave no spawn of rot to fester in your wake.
Palace of the Plaguelord: The Palace of Rot
Defeat Skoroth and burn his Palace down. Tear down the gates and claim what was promised by the raven.Let the foul crown fall beneath the heel of vengeance.
[[col:red]]This Regiment of Renown will unlock only if you ally or Confederate the Baersonling Tribe or have Einarr Sigdansson in your faction[[/col]]
Deemed ''The Grandfather of all the Ymir" by Einarr Sigdansson, who faught this gigantic beast for two days on end before forcing it down to it's knees.
Deemed ''The Grandfather of all the Ymir" by Einarr Sigdansson, who faught this gigantic beast for two days on end before forcing it down to it's knees.
Unlike most Ymir, this gigantic beast bears the clear taint of chaos. During a snowstorm it once killed over fifty Aesling whilst remaining unseen
Follow Einarr on his narrative driven journey as Tzeentch sends him to the gates of Nurgle's palace

Far from the shattered halls of Vinnskor, Einarr Sigdansson dreams of a black-winged messenger. The raven speaks of oaths unbroken and bloodlines yet unextinguished - "Return to Vinnskor," it cries, "for what was lost may yet be taken back."-  Driven by vision and vengeance, Einarr knows his destiny lies not in wandering foreign shores, but in leading the Baersonlings home—to reclaim their honour and their land by axe and fire.

Skoroth is dead. The raven speaks again—but now in a voice like cracking ice. It is no longer Tzeentch, but Yth’nitzzilik, daemon of deceit. You were never dealing with a god. The pact was a lie, the promise a poison. But the Festerheart lies in your hands, pulsing. Asta... could yet return. You feel betrayed, tricked—and yet, what choice remains?

You have fled with your people into exile, the Baersonlings broken and scattered. Vinnskor, your homeland, was lost to an Aesling raid of brutal fury. Now, in restless sleep, the gods mock your powerlessness—you are made to relive the attack again and again. Blood, fire, and the scream that ended your world echo endlessly. Your wife falls each time. You never reach her in time.

This sickly, jaundiced orb was hacked from the skull of Bubos, the Dragon of the Lakes of Rot. Though long dead, the eye still weeps pus and stares unblinking into realms unseen. Those who bear it feel a slow pulse of festering power, as if the eye is ever searching, ever watching — draining the life of nearby foes with its lingering, necrotic glare.
